all.label: Pdf Customiser by Fooman
all.comment: For detailed instructions please refer to the Pdf Customiser User Manual here.

alllogo.label: Logo for the Pdf
alllogo.tooltip: Upload your logo as a gif, jpeg or png file. A good size for the automatic placement versions is 700 pixels wide and 300 pixels high.

alllogoplacement.label: Placement of Logo
alllogoplacement.tooltip:
• Automatic Right – the logo will be positioned in the top right corner, scaled to measure 2.5cm high (with width scaled accordingly, depending on the shape/size of the file)
• Automatic Left – the logo will be positioned in the top left corner, scaled to measure 2.5cm high (with width scaled accordingly, depending on the shape/size of the file)
• No-Scaling Right – the logo will be positioned in the top right corner, but will not be scaled to fit
• No-Scaling Left – the logo will be positioned in the top left corner, but will not be scaled to fit
• Manual – additional options will appear to customise the position and dimensions of the logo. The text on the Pdf will always appear below the logo placement, so it is recommended to place the logo in the top of the page.

alllogofromleft.label: Logo top-left Corner from the left

alllogofromtop.label: Logo top-left Corner from the top

allbgimage.label: Background Image for Pdf
allbgimage.tooltip: Upload an image that will be used as a background to the pdfs. Images will be scaled (but not distorted) to fit the page.

fields.alllogobgprinting: Hide Logo/Background when Printing as Admin Hide logo and/or background when printing pdfs via admin. select pdfcustomiser/system_logoBackgroundPrintingOptions 11 1 1 1> 1

allbgimagefirstpageonly.label: Display Background only on first page
allbgimagefirstpageonly.tooltip: Applicable only if you have uploaded a background image. When set to No, the image will appear on each page of the pdf document. When set to Yes, the image will only appear on the first page of the pdf document.

allowneraddress.label: Store Address
allowneraddress.tooltip: Enter your store's address as you would like it to appear in the pdfs. This field can also be used for free text or {{}} commands such as {{var order.customer_id}}. Refer to "Developer Bonus - {{}} Commands" in the manual for more information.

allfooter1.label: Footer Block 1
allfooter1.tooltip:
You can use up to 4 footer blocks to add customised footer content. The width of the footer blocks will automatically adjust to accommodate 1, 2, 3 or 4 footers in the space available.

You can use simple HTML like <p></p>, <br/> in these fields. To add an image, you could enter something like<img src="http://example.com/path/to/image.jpg"/>.

Footers will start where the bottom and side margins are set. For example, if the bottom margin is set to 5, the footer will start at 5cm above the bottom of the page. Make sure the bottom margin is large enough if you have a lot of text in the footers.

allprintbarcode.label: Display Order Barcode
allprintbarcode.tooltip: When set to “Yes”, the order number will be displayed as a barcode, in addition to being displayed as a number.

allrowtotaltaxinclusive.label: Display Row Subtotal Including Tax
allrowtotaltaxinclusive.tooltip:
When set to No, individual item row subtotals will be displayed as tax exclusive. When set to Yes, individual item row subtotals will be displayed as tax inclusive.

This setting is only effective if Tax > Orders, Invoices, Creditmemos Display Settings > Display Prices (below) is set to “Excluding Tax”. Otherwise, this setting has no effect.
allrowtotaltaxinclusive.comment: is only effective if Tax > Orders, Invoices, Creditmemos Display Settings > Prices is set to not display taxes

allonly1grandtotal.label: Display only one Grand Total
allonly1grandtotal.tooltip:
When set to No, it will have the following effect:
no       Subtotal
           Shipping
           Grandtotal excl. tax
           tax
           Grandtotal incl. tax

When set to Yes, it will have the following effect:
yes      Subtotal
           Shipping
           Tax
           Grandtotal

displayboth.label: Display Base and Order Currency
displayboth.tooltip: When set to No, pdfs will always display the order currency. When set to Yes, pdfs will display the base currency in addition to order currency.

allmarginbottom.label: Bottom Margin
allmarginbottom.tooltip: Set the bottom margin large enough to accommodate any footers and the page number. If the bottom margin is set too low, this can result in the footer blocks taking up all available space and there being no room to display the page number.

allaltlayout.label: Use Alternative Layout
allaltlayout.tooltip:
When set to Yes, a box will be added around the following headings:
• Sold to
• Ship to
• Payment method
• Shipping method
• Column

Refer to Pdf Layout Options in the manual for a comparison of the standard layout and alternative layout.

allfont.label: Font
allfont.tooltip:
System fonts (Helvetica, Times and Courier) offer the largest potential pdf size reduction (up to 95%), but might not show all international characters (see troubleshooting)
• Dejavu fonts offer broader international character support (UTF-8), but do not offer the same pdf size reduction as system fonts
• Use the Arial fonts for Chinese, Korean or Japanese markets where the Adobe character package is widely installed. This option also offers up to 90% potential pdf size reduction.

allcustomfont.label: Upload Custom Font
allcustomfont.tooltip: Upload any true type font with a .ttf file extension. Once uploaded, save the configuration. You will then be able to select your font from the drop down box in the “Font” setting above this option. You must have a writable lib/tcpdf/fonts directory to use this setting. Custom fonts do not offer the same potential pdf size reduction as system fonts.
allcustomfont.comment: Upload your font here (.ttf file extension).

allfontsize.label: Base Font Size
allfontsize.tooltip:
Change the size of the base font.
• Headings will be scaled to 133% of the base font
• Footers and line items will be automatically scaled to 80% of the base font, when the base font size is set to 12 or higher.

allpagenumbers.label: Display Page Number
allpagenumbers.tooltip: When set to Yes, the page number will automatically be displayed in the centre bottom of the document.

allqtyasint.label: Display Quantity as full number
allqtyasint.tooltip: When set to Yes, quantities will be displayed as a full number (eg. 1.0000 units will be displayed as 1 unit). This is the recommended default setting. When set to No, quantities will be displayed as a partial number (eg. 1.9500 units).

allsalesruletitle.label: Display Salesrule instead of Coupon Code
allsalesruletitle.tooltip: When set to Yes, the promotion name of any coupon code set up under Promotions > Shopping Cart Price Rules will be displayed on the pdf, instead of the coupon code.

alltaxsummary.tooltip: When set to Yes, the pdf document will include details of tax is applied to items.
alltaxsummary.label: Display detailed Tax Summary

alldisplayweight.label: Display Total Weight
alldisplayweight.tooltip: When set to Yes, the total weight will be displayed. This setting may be useful for shipping purposes.

allweightunit.label: Weight Unit
allweightunit.tooltip: Applicable only if the “Display Total Weight” setting is enabled. The default setting is kg.

allcustomcolumn.label: Custom Column Attribute
allcustomcolumn.tooltip: Select up to five product attributes to display in your pdf documents. Important: Once you have done this, you also need to enable the corresponding custom columns to be shown under the “Columns” setting for each pdf where you want to show custom columns (Order/Invoice/Shipment/Credit Memo).

alldisplayemail.label: Display Email Address
alldisplayemail.tooltip: Displays the customers email address on the pdf.

allbarcode.label: Barcode Type
allbarcode.tooltip: If you have chosen to show barcodes under the “Columns” setting for each pdf (Order/Invoice/Shipment/Credit Memo), choose how barcodes will be displayed. The default setting is CODE 39 EXTENDED + CHECKSUM. Ensure that you select the correct barcode type for the SKU you are using, or pdf generation could fail!
allbarcode.comment: Please make sure the barcode type is appropriate for the content or the pdf generation might fail (Default: CODE 39 EXTENDED + CHECKSUM).

allprintcomments.label: Print Order History with Comments
allprintcomments.tooltip: When set to All, comments inputted under Sales > Orders > Comment History will be added to the pdf (the comments you see in the back-end order view history).

allsign.label: Digitally Sign Pdf
allsign.tooltip: When set to Yes, your pdf files will be secured with a digital signature to prevent the integrity of the document from being compromised by other parties. Once you have digitally signed the pdf document, no one will be able to alter the document without invalidating it. Your private key will be stored encrypted in the Magento database so please include this in your security considerations.

allsigncertificate.label: Signature
allsigncertificate.tooltip: Enter the contents of your certificate/signature file, including your private key. Include everything from -----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY----- to -----END CERTIFICATE-----

allsignpassword.label: Password of Signature
allsignpassword.tooltip: Enter the password for the digital signature.

allnewwindow.label: Display Pdf in New Window
allnewwindow.tooltip: When set to Yes, pdf documents will be generated in a new window.

subtotal.label: Subtotal
subtotal.tooltip:
This setting allows you to adjust the order in which different total figures appear in pdf documents. The different total figures will be ordered according to the assigned number - for example, enter 100 for the item you wish to appear first, 200 for the item you wish to appear next, and so on.

Entering “NO” for a total will suppress the output of this total on the pdf. The Grand Total will always show.

ordertitle.label: Order Title
ordertitle.tooltip: Enter a title for the order pdf.

orderaddresses.label: Customer Addresses
orderaddresses.tooltip:
Which addresses should appear on the pdf? Choose shipping address, billing address or both (downloadable product orders won't have a shipping address). Swapping around the order of the billing and shipping addresses is possible – see the Developer Bonuses section in the manual for more information.

You can customise the address format by accessing System > Configuration > Customer Configuration > Address Templates > Pdf. The | character will be converted into a line break.

ordercolumns.label: Columns
ordercolumns.tooltip:
Control-click to select the columns you want to display in the pdf. Choose from:
• Position (orders the products automatically by adding a number)
• Product name
• Product name with extra white space
• SKU
• Product + SKU (displays the product name and SKU, separated by a line break)
• SKU barcode (displays the SKU as a barcode - if enabled, you also need to select a setting for “Barcode Type” in the Pdf Customiser by Fooman settings)
• Product image
• Price
• Discount
• Qty
• Qty ordered
• Qty back ordered
• Qty detailed
• Item status
• Tax
• Tax rate
• Subtotal
• Alternative subtotal
• Row total
• Custom columns 1-5 (must be enabled under ”Custom Attribute Column” (in the Pdf Customiser by Fooman settings)

There is no maximum number, but the more columns you select, the smaller they will become in order to fit on the same page.

ordercolumnssort.label: Sort by Column
ordercolumnssort.tooltip: Choose which column to sort items by (alphabetical/ascending order). The default setting retains current Magento settings.

ordercustom.label: Custom Text
ordercustom.tooltip: Add custom text to appear at the bottom of the pdf. Use free text, simple html or {{}} commands.

invoicetitle.label: Invoice Title
invoicetitle.tooltip: Enter a title for the invoice pdf.

invoicetaxnumber.label: Tax Details
invoicetaxnumber.tooltip: Free text field – choose to include tax details (eg. tax number).

invoiceaddresses.label: Customer Addresses
invoiceaddresses.tooltip:
Which addresses should appear on the pdf? Choose from shipping address, billing address or both. Note that downloadable product orders won't have a shipping address.

If the customer VAT number is entered during checkout, this will be shown as part of the billing address by default.

Swapping around the order of the billing and shipping addresses is possible – see the Developer Bonuses section for more information.

You can customise the customer address format by accessing System > Configuration > Customer Configuration > Address Templates > Pdf. The | character will be converted into a line break.

invoicedeliverydate.label: Display Delivery Date
invoicedeliverydate.tooltip: When set to Yes, the invoice date will be re-displayed as the delivery date. Use this setting for shipments to countries which require invoices to state a delivery date (such as Germany).

invoiceintegratedlabels.label: Use Integrated Labels
invoiceintegratedlabels.tooltip:
Select “Yes” to use integrated labels. Each label measures 85mm x 54mm. Labels measure positioned 20mm from the side and 23mm from bottom.

Choose from the following standard labels:
• Single – Shipping Address Label
• Single – Billing Address Label
• Double – Shipping and Billing Addresses
• Double – Shipping and Return Addresses
• Double – Shipping and Return Addresses with Image (image is taken from /media/pdf-printouts/print_label.gif)
• Custom Label Left Shipping Address
• Custom Label Right Shipping Address
• Custom Label Left Billing Address
• Custom Label Right Billing Address

The return address is the same as the store address.

Customise the labels by adjusting the following template file to achieve your desired format:
app/design/frontend/base/default/template/fooman/ pdfcustomiser/label.phtml

You can choose both a left and right option using control-click. When editing the files, it is also possible to remove the shipping/billing address to have a completely custom label.

Changing the position of the labels is also possible – see the Developer Bonuses section for more information.

shipmenttitle.label: Shipment Title
shipmenttitle.tooltip: Enter a title for the shipment pdf.

shipmentuseorder.label: Print Order as Packing Slip
shipmentuseorder.tooltip:
When set to Yes, you can bypass the standard workflow requirement by printing packing slips without first having to create a Magento shipment. You can do this regardless of order status. However, you will lose the ability to print the packing slips with the shipment number (the order number is used instead).

Use this setting if you are getting the following error message: “There are no printable documents related to selected orders”
